title._content: Portraits G.W. Evans and William Cox, 1813-1814

description._content: G.W. Evans was enlisted by Governor Macquarie as surveyor of this area of the Blue Mountains, who was sent through the "extensive valley" through to the Bathurst Plains, with the intention of mapping out the natural landscape of the area around Glenroy and Cox's River. William Cox was subsequently employed, along with his men, to build roads in accordance to what Evans had surveyed. Source: "Historic Glenroy and Cox's River, Hartley NSW" This image is part of a collection entitled ‘Historic Glenroy, Cox's River', which is available to view on the Royal Australian Historical Society's Historypin Channel. Access the collection at the following link: www.historypin.com/channels/view/48441#tab-home|collectio... Please feel free to comment on this or any of the other images in the collection. If you have more accurate information regarding the location and/or date of the image, we would love to hear from you!
